citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
***The 6 yr old female Dachshund "Fallon"(chip #000010547361) is very thin (BCS 3/9), her vertebrae and ribs are easily
palpated with very little fat observed around her abdomen. Fallon has a large accumulation of a gray colored material on
her upper and lower teeth on both sides of her mouth, her gums in these areas are reddened and swollen. Allowing
accumulations of tartar can interfere with the dogs ability to eat and drink inhibiting proper nutrition and it can cause the
development of infections of the gums that may lead to additional illness. Fallon's dental record indicates she was last
checked in April 2023 and was to be watched but there is no follow-up exam recorded.
Fallon must be examined and appropriate care provided to protect her health and well-being.
Correct by December 27, 2023.

***There is one enclosure housing a female dachshund with seven puppies and another housing a female dachshund with
one puppy. There are two enclosures containing a single dachshund puppy each. There is no identification for the
puppies provided on the identification boards above the enclosures, cage cards, or by any other means. All puppies
require identification as required in this section. If cage cards are used to identify the puppies they must have the puppies
individual number, and means of identification such as distinctive colors or markings, sex, etc. The cards must be
attached to the front of the enclosure.
Correct by December 27, 2023.

***There are discarded empty bags, spilled food, antifreeze containers, etc dispersed among the bags of dog food.
Accumulations of trash and waste material and chemicals increase the risk of food contamination and the presence of
vermin or problems with pest control. The food storage area must be kept free of clutter with items properly stored to
prevent contamination.
Correct by December 27, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2)  Direct
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
***The 6 yr old female Dachshund "Fallon"(chip #000010547361)  is very thin (BCS 3/9), her vertebrae  and ribs are easily 
palpated with very little fat observed  around her abdomen. Fallon has a large accumulation of a gray colored material on 
her upper and lower teeth on both sides of her mouth, her gums in these areas are reddened and swollen. Allowing 
accumulations of tartar can interfere with the dogs ability to eat and drink inhibiting proper nutrition and it can cause the 
development  of infections of the gums that may lead to additional illness. Fallon's dental record indicates she was last 
checked in April 2023 and was to be watched but there is no follow-up exam recorded. 
 
Fallon must be examined and appropriate care provided to protect her health and well-being. 
 
Correct by December 27, 2023. 
2.50(a)(2) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
***There is one enclosure housing a female dachshund with seven puppies and another housing a female dachshund with 
one puppy. There are two enclosures containing a single dachshund puppy each. There is no identification for the 
puppies provided  on the identification boards above  the enclosures, cage cards, or by any other means. All puppies 
require identification as required in this section. If cage cards are used to identify the puppies they must have the puppies 
individual number, and means of identification such as distinctive colors or markings, sex, etc. The cards must be 
attached to the front of the enclosure.  
 
Correct by December 27, 2023. 
3.1(b) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
***There are discarded empty bags, spilled food, antifreeze containers, etc dispersed among the bags of dog food. 
Accumulations of trash and waste material and chemicals increase the risk of food contamination and the presence of 
vermin or problems with pest control. The food storage area must be kept free of clutter with items properly stored to

prevent contamination. 
 
Correct by December 27, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Owner.
